# Bug hunting on Android apps

2025-09-23 2 min read
android frida
Table of Contents
  • Install frida-tool
  • Setting up Emulator
  • Warning
  • 1) Rooting Emulator
  • 2) Install frida on Emulator
  • Installing and running apk file

This guide provides a concise cheatsheet to set up the Android Emulator on Linux (and possibly macOS), gain root access, and configure Frida to bypass SSL pinning of an Android application.

Install frida-tool

Setting up Emulator

  1. Download and install Android studio, run it and navigate to AVD to create an emulator. I prefer using Pixel 5. Select the minimum SDK version (Google Play or Open Source) required for your APK:
  1. Choose either x86 or x86_64 - one might work for a particular application, while the other might not. Same for SDK versions. Do not expect any application to run successfully.

If the emulator won’t run, try:

Warning

Pay attention to which SDK version and arch you use in the next commands

1) Rooting Emulator

  1. Run in your terminal:
  1. Run Emulator again
  2. Open Magisk, allow notifications and click Ok to reboot
  3. Run Magisk again and update it if asked

2) Install frida on Emulator

  1. Check frida version on your system:
  1. Download corresponding version of magisk-frida from https://github.com/ViRb3/magisk-frida/releases/
  2. Transfer zip file to the device:
  1. Open Magisk on Emulator, click Module and select Install from Storage, navigate to sdk_hphone64_x86_64 and select the archive
  2. Wait and click Reboot
  3. Disable protection (not sure if it’s necessary):
  1. Import Burp cert from proxy options and upload to the device:
  1. Ensure frida-server is running:
  1. Check if it’s working on host machine:

Installing and running apk file

  1. Set up Burp proxy listener on 0.0.0.0:8081
  2. Run Emulator with proxy:
  1. Install your apk which you downloaded from APK Pure or APK Mirror:
  1. Start your App
  2. Run frida-script on host machine:

Another frida scripts if the previous fails:

No matter where you are, everyone is always connected
